image: What objects are present in the image?
How many people are in the image?
What colors are dominant in the scene?
What is the spatial relationship between objects X and Y?
Is this an indoor or outdoor scene?
What actions are being performed in the image?
What text is visible in the image?
What emotions are expressed by people in the image?
What time of day does this image appear to be taken?
Are there any identifiable landmarks or locations?
What is the estimated age range of people in the image?
What clothing or accessories are people wearing?
What is the main subject/focus of the image?
Are there any animals in the image? What kinds?
text: What named entities (people, organizations, locations) are mentioned in the text?
What are the main topics discussed in the text?
What relationships exist between the entities mentioned?
What actions or events are described in the text?
What temporal information is mentioned (dates, times, durations)?
What sentiments are expressed toward specific entities?
Are there any causal relationships described?
What numerical data or statistics are mentioned?
What questions are asked in the text?
What opinions or subjective statements are made?
Are there any contradictions or logical inconsistencies in the text?
What references to external sources or citations are included?
What is the reading level or complexity of the text?
Are there any instructions or procedural steps described?
audio: What words are spoken in the audio?
How many distinct speakers are there?
What is the emotional tone of the speakers?
Are there any non-speech sounds? What are they?
What is the background environment (noisy, quiet, outdoors, indoors)?
Is there music present? What genre/style?
What is the pace or rhythm of speech/music?
Are there any distinguishable accents or dialects?
What is the volume level and variation throughout the audio?
Are there any audio cues indicating transitions or sections?
What is the clarity or quality of the audio?
Is there overlapping speech or sounds?
What is the gender distribution of speakers?
Are there any distinctive voice characteristics (deep, high-pitched, raspy)?
What is the duration of speech versus non-speech elements?
